metadata.title: CVE-2022-0696 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
NULL Pointer Dereference in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4428.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0696` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-athena - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk3 - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-gui-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-motif - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-nox - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-runtime - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-tiny - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
xxd - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

notes.note: ccdm94> the line presented as the one containing the instruction that triggers the error in the bug report stack trace was introduced by commit a1198124370a (>= 8.2.3629). Eventhough the code for focal and impish is very similar to the vulnerable one, the reproducer does not work for impish and earlier, further indicating that the previously mentioned commit might have been the one to introduce the issue.

criterions.comment: vim package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4').
